becker.io
Class ConsoleInput

java.lang.Object
  becker.io.TextInput
      becker.io.ConsoleInput

public class ConsoleInput
extends TextInput

ConsoleInput extends TextInput to provide services useful for dealing with error-prone humans interacting via a keyboard.

Author:
Byron Weber Becker

Method Detail

demandInt

public int demandInt(String prompt)
Demand an integer from the user. The user is prompted repeatedly until an integer is entered.

Parameters:
prompt - The prompt to display to the user.
Returns:
The integer entered by the user.

demandInt

public int demandInt(String prompt,
                     int defaultValue)
Demand an integer from the user. Provide a default which is returned if the user simply hits 'Return'.

Parameters:
prompt - The prompt to display to the user.
defaultValue - The value to return if the user hits 'Return'.
Returns:
The integer entered or the default value.

requestInt

public boolean requestInt(String prompt)
Request an integer from the user. The user may provide a value or hit 'Return' to decline to give a value. This is typically used to indicate the end of a series of values.

Parameters:
prompt - The prompt to display to the user.
Returns:
true if the user provided an integer value (which may be obtained with a call to getInt(); false if the user declined to provide a value.
